summary: This document is an email chain from April 2021 regarding the criminal case U.S. v. Maxwell (S2 20 Cr. 330). It involves communication between defense attorneys and a federal prosecutor about scheduling a call to discuss a letter filed with Judge Nathan, and includes the submission of a courtesy copy of a court filing.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell who sends a courtesy copy of a court filing to the prosecution team.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Defense attorney copied on the email containing the court filing.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Defense attorney copied on the email containing the court filing.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Defense attorney copied on the email containing the court filing.

connections.description: Both are defense attorneys copied on the same legal correspondence regarding the Maxwell case.

events.title: Filing of Letter with Judge Nathan
events.description: Defense files a letter with Judge Alison J. Nathan, which is then provided as a courtesy copy to the prosecution.

events.title: Prosecution Request for Call
events.description: The prosecution requests a call with the defense to discuss the filed letter, in light of a court order for a response.

events.title: Submission of Letter to Court
events.description: An email indicates the attached letter is 'for submission,' likely finalizing a filing to the court.

keyFacts: The document is part of the discovery in the criminal case U.S. v. Maxwell (S2 20 Cr. 330).
It shows active legal correspondence between Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York in April 2021.
The defense filed a letter with Judge Alison J. Nathan, prompting discussion and a requested call between prosecution and defense.
The email chain demonstrates the procedural coordination and scheduling between legal parties in a high-profile case.
Multiple defense attorneys (Sternheim, Everdell, Menninger, Pagliuca) are shown working together on the case.
